If people treat trading without respect they are gambling. They may just prefer the odds to betting on horses. That should be legal.  If they have respect for the art like myself then it is a full time occupation that is a reliable source of income over time

Because i am a believer in my rights, my business will be leaving the UK   @RealCryptoV  does do some good work but on this occasion you missed the mark with your blanket approach  I assume with that kind of approach you want sports betting banned also? & casinos? And casino films?

.... do all sorts of dodgy stuff, i dont, i show my open trades every day whether they are in profit or not. I am good at trading, most people are not. But because of nanny state authoritarians that cant trade for toffee derivatives are being banned in the uk.

But ive spoken to  @RealCryptoV  many times in the past, i’m surprised to see this backstab from someone who i expected knows better.   Someone who I’ve met in person.   It is disappointing to see such misrepresentation. Yes people mis promote, promise gains......

IF YOU DO NOT TRADE YOU SHOULD NOT LINK AN EXCHANGE because that is disingenuous and predatory if you are giving advice.  If like myself where i do trade all the time, i get asked for my ref link all the time as kind of a subscriber donation model, after all, my content is free.

And calling anybody that promotes an exchange a ‘Fraud’ and a ‘Scammer’ is defamatory.  There are safe ways to promote and unsafe ways, just as there are safe ways to use a knife but it can also kill you... should we ban knifes?  @RealCryptoV

Ultimately if people want to gamble, let them. If they dont, they dont have to...  If they want to trade and be serious then they stand a lot better chance of not getting rekt  I have no issues with  @Bybit_Official  referral links, this is a business not a charity.

On top of this contrary to popular belief put forward by bad actors, it is not profitable to encourage anybody to trade high leverage. There is no advantage to this, they will get rekt unless they are using leverage to withdraw equity which is something I’ve done in the past

To add to this point, the whole “exposing” community has lost its way. They do not focus on actual scams, the focus on creating shock factor content.  Case in point, i actively promote the safe use of these platforms and call out anybody promoting risky trading

I have now, im not breaking any laws or rules, i dont believe it is wrong fundamentally at all because i believe people are within their rights to do what they want with their money, im not a fan of nanny state  @RealCryptoV   People lose money, people make money, that is trading..
